questions.text: What is cryptography?
questions.explanation: Cryptography is the practice and study of techniques for secure communication in the presence of adversaries.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of symmetric encryption?
questions.explanation: AES (Advanced Encryption Standard) is a type of symmetric encryption.

questions.text: Asymmetric encryption uses the same key for encryption and decryption.
questions.explanation: Asymmetric encryption uses different keys for encryption and decryption.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of asymmetric encryption?
questions.explanation: RSA is a type of asymmetric encryption.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a digital signature?
questions.explanation: A digital signature provides authentication and integrity.

questions.text: Hashing is a form of encryption.
questions.explanation: Hashing is a one-way function used for integrity, not encryption.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a hash function?
questions.explanation: A hash function creates a fixed-size digest of a message.

questions.text: Which of the following is a common hash algorithm?
questions.explanation: SHA-256 is a common hash algorithm.

questions.text: A collision occurs when two different messages produce the same hash value.
questions.explanation: A collision occurs when two different messages produce the same hash value.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a salt in cryptography?
questions.explanation: A salt is used to protect against rainbow table attacks.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key exchange algorithm?
questions.explanation: Diffie-Hellman is a key exchange algorithm.

questions.text: A digital certificate verifies the identity of a website.
questions.explanation: A digital certificate verifies the identity of a website.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a certificate authority (CA)?
questions.explanation: A certificate authority (CA) issues digital certificates.

questions.text: Which of the following is a block cipher mode of operation?
questions.explanation: CBC (Cipher Block Chaining) is a block cipher mode of operation.

questions.text: A stream cipher encrypts data one bit or byte at a time.
questions.explanation: A stream cipher encrypts data one bit or byte at a time.

questions.text: Which of the following is a stream cipher?
questions.explanation: RC4 is a stream cipher.

questions.text: What is steganography?
questions.explanation: Steganography is the practice of concealing a message within another message or object.

questions.text: Cryptography provides confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
questions.explanation: Cryptography primarily provides confidentiality and integrity.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a keylogger?
questions.explanation: A keylogger records keystrokes.

questions.text: Which of the following is a type of attack against cryptographic systems?
questions.explanation: A brute-force attack attempts to guess passwords or keys.
